question: List the activity metrics for Volume B9—Iron & Steel Producers and Volume B50—Industrial Machinery & Goods industries.
optionA: For Iron & Steel Producers: Raw steel production, percentage from: (1) basic oxygen furnace processes, (2) electric arc furnace processes; Total iron ore production; Total coking coal production. For Industrial Machinery & Goods: Number of units produced by product category; Number of employees.
optionB: For Iron & Steel Producers: None. For Industrial Machinery & Goods: None.
optionC: For Iron & Steel Producers: Total energy consumed. For Industrial Machinery & Goods: Total energy consumed.
optionD: For Iron & Steel Producers: Raw material sourcing risks. For Industrial Machinery & Goods: Emissions of nitrogen oxides (NOx) and particulate matter (PM).
optionE: For Iron & Steel Producers: None listed. For Industrial Machinery & Goods: None listed.
reference_text: Table 2. Activity Metrics: For Iron & Steel Producers: Raw steel production, percentage from: (1) basic oxygen furnace processes, (2) electric arc furnace processes; Total iron ore production; Total coking coal production.
Table 2. Activity Metrics: For Industrial Machinery & Goods: Number of units produced by product category; Number of employees.
pairing_explanation: These industries are interrelated as steel production feeds into machinery manufacturing, necessitating reviews of supply chain sustainability and emissions.

question: Give me all the metrics from Table 1 that are in category 'Discussion and Analysis' for Volume B9—Iron & Steel Producers and Volume B50—Industrial Machinery & Goods industries.

question: For the Iron & Steel Producers and Industrial Machinery & Goods industries, what are the codes for all the 'Quantitative' metrics in Table 1?

| Greenhouse Gas Emissions | Gross global Scope 1 emissions, percentage covered under emissions-limiting regulations | Quantitative | Metric tons (t) CO₂-e, Percentage (%) | EM-IS-110a.1 |

question: When calculating emissions metrics, what is the key difference between Iron & Steel Producers and Industrial Machinery & Goods companies?
optionA: Iron & Steel Producers calculate emissions based on the amount of raw materials processed, while Industrial Machinery & Goods calculate emissions based on the fuel efficiency of their products.
optionB: There is no difference, both industries calculate emissions the same way based on total energy consumption.
optionC: Iron & Steel Producers calculate Scope 1 emissions, while Industrial Machinery & Goods calculate emissions produced during the use phase of their products.
optionD: Industrial Machinery & Goods companies are not required to report any emissions metrics.
optionE: The industries use completely different methodologies for calculating emissions that are not specified in the reporting standards.
